meanings.definition: A small, black and grey bird of the crow family, with a distinctive call.
meanings.sent1: The jackdaw perched on the branch and cawed loudly.
meanings.sent2: I saw a jackdaw flying gracefully across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous jackdaw stole shiny objects to decorate its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the call of a jackdaw in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The jackdaw's feathers shimmered in the sunlight, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A person who collects miscellaneous items.
meanings.sent1: The old man was known in the village as a jackdaw for his love of antiques.
meanings.sent2: She had the eye of a jackdaw, always finding unique trinkets.
meanings.sent3: The jackdaw of the family, he kept every ticket stub from his travels.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a treasure trove, a sanctuary for a modern-day jackdaw.
meanings.sent5: He was a jackdaw of memories, holding onto each one dearly.
